titlePart.text: SECTION D TEXTILES AND PAPER
TEXTILES AND FLEXIBLE MATERIALS NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR
TREATMENT OF TEXTILES, etc.
LAUNDERING
FLEXIBLE MATERIALS NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR
TREATING TEXTILE MATERIALS BY LIQUIDS, GASES, OR VAPOURS
titlePart.entryReference: applying liquids to surfaces in general
conveying in general, handling webs or filaments in general
treating leather
mechanical removal of impurities from animal fibres
laundering
chemical matters

noteParagraph.text: In this sub-class, the term "fabric" is to be understood as including yarns in warp or sheet form, and the term "textile material" as including fabrics, yarns or other fibrous materials.

In this sub-class, the expression "indefinite length" is to be understood as applying to an extent of material having the characteristic that the longitudinal dimension is effectively infinite in so far as the procedure for advancing or moving the material is concerned.

titlePart.text: FINISHING, DRESSING, TENTERING, OR STRETCHING TEXTILE FABRICS
titlePart.entryReference: chemical matters
drying

noteParagraph.text: In this sub-class, the term "fabric" is to be understood as including yarns in warp or sheet form.

titlePart.text: LAUNDERING
titlePart.entryReference: see , for chemical matters apparatus for blocking, pressing, steaming, or stretching hats

noteParagraph.text: This sub-class includes domestic and laundry dry-cleaning apparatus using volatile solvents.
This sub-class includes domestic, laundry, and tailors' ironing or other hot-pressing of clothes, linen, and other textile articles.
Apparatus for wringing, washing, dry-cleaning, ironing, and other hot-pressing of textiles in manufacturing operations is provided for in , .

titlePart.text: MECHANICAL OR PRESSURE CLEANING OF CARPETS, RUGS, SACKS, HIDES, OR OTHER SKIN OR TEXTILE ARTICLES OR FABRICS
TURNING INSIDE-OUT FLEXIBLE TUBULAR OR OTHER HOLLOW ARTICLES
titlePart.entryReference: mechanical preparation or mechanical treatment of bed feathers

titlePart.text: MARKING, INSPECTING, SEAMING, OR SEVERING TEXTILE MATERIALS
titlePart.entryReference: seaming by sewing
in connection with manufacturing, see the relevant sub-classes

titlePart.text: PLEATING, KILTING, OR GOFFERING TEXTILE FABRICS OR WEARING APPAREL
titlePart.entryReference: corrugating, creasing, or otherwise deforming paper, or material worked in a manner analogous to paper, without removing material
by weaving
by sewing
apparatus for pressing or setting formed pleats

titlePart.text: BLEACHING, e.g. OPTICAL BLEACHING, DRY-CLEANING, OR WASHING FIBRES, THREADS, YARNS, FABRICS, FEATHERS, OR MADE-UP FIBROUS GOODS
BLEACHING LEATHER OR FURS
titlePart.entryReference: see , , for mechanical matters treatment of fibres or filaments of glass, mineral wool, or slag wool
chemical treatment of fibrous material to obtain fibres for spinning
bleaching paper pulp or cotton linters

titlePart.text: TREATMENT, NOT PROVIDED FOR ELSEWHERE IN CLASS , OF FIBRES, THREADS, YARNS, FABRICS, FEATHERS, OR FIBROUS GOODS MADE FROM SUCH MATERIALS
titlePart.entryReference: see for other mechanical matters per se

titlePart.text: WALL, FLOOR, AND LIKE COVERING MATERIALS, e.g. LINOLEUM, OILCLOTH, ARTIFICIAL LEATHER, ROOFING FELT, CONSISTING OF A FIBROUS WEB COATED WITH A LAYER OF MACROMOLECULAR MATERIAL
FLEXIBLE SHEET MATERIAL NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR
titlePart.entryReference: laminates in general
coated webs which retain the character of paper or cardboard

noteParagraph.text: Layered products classified in this sub-class are also classified in sub-class .

titlePart.text: DYEING OR PRINTING TEXTILES
DYEING LEATHER, FURS, OR SOLID MACROMOLECULAR SUBSTANCES IN ANY FORM
titlePart.entryReference: see , , for mechanical matters printing on surfaces of materials other than textiles
dyeing glass fibres
mordanting
dyeing paper

titlePart.text: DECORATING TEXTILES
titlePart.entryReference: see , for mechanical matters dyeing or printing
